column4: i'm trying to install gutsy from livecd, but it doesn't show my partitions, neither the installation program nor gparted, it only shows /dev/sda, no partitions
however
ls /dev | grep sda, shows my partitions
tried fdisk ?
you mean the fdisk tool for windows?
no Linux, same name.
what does that do? how can i use it?
have you the LiveCD going ?
yep, i'm using it right now
just checking, do you know what device your HDD is ?
/dev/sda ?
in a terminal, the command would be "sudo fdisk /dev/sda"
is this a new drive ?
nope
i had feisty + windows xp before
this doesn't happen when i use the feisty livecd
oh, I don't know what is going on, does fdisk find the partition data ?
i can even manually mount a partition :S
don't know whats wrong.
that makes two of us, thanks for the help
I have heard that windows can screw the partition table, if a small partition is used for windows.
